reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am surprised to read the TripAdvisor reviews of visits to the Ambassade in August. We were there for two nights mid-month, and while it is a very lovely spot, with beautiful common rooms and a very good breakfast, we found the lack of air conditioning to be a real problem. We were also astounded at the elevator situation. Because the five buildings have not been made to communicate with one another, one must use the treacherous "tower" stairs (yes, very charming but not very navigable) or use the elevator which did not bring us anywhere near our room. We had to ascend and descend another two flights of tower stairs to get there, not to mention wrong turns and switchbacks along the way. The bellboy told us that the hardest part of his job had been learning how to navigate the hotel using the elevator!
reviews.title: Charming, but absurd.

likes.disliked: — lack of air conditioning and absurdity of elevator

reviews.title: Hotel Ambassade
reviews.text: My suggestion to middle aged travelers: Get a (very expensive) room on the first floor, and visit in spring, winter or fall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel in a super location. Series of old canal houses converted into lovely and comfortable rooms overlooking the canal.Our room had huge glass windows that opened up opposite our comfortable sitting area where we could watch the boats sail by and take in the afternoon and early evening sun. Thehotel also had a beautiful breakfast room and adjacent sitting room. There was a lovely library downstairs and ample room in various sitting areas in and about the lobby. They also had free internet! Staff was pleasant aand most helpful, especially w/restaurant recommendations. Staying here was like being a resident of the neighborhood. A wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Stellar location, fine hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We spent 3 happy nights at the Ambassade. The hotel has a great location for exploring Amsterdam. Easy half-hour walk to the Van Gogh museum (we went on Friday evening, when it stays open late, and found it relatively uncrowded) or, in the other direction, to the main Railroad Station. Lots to see in between.
reviews.title: One of the best in Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had a lovely two-room suite - one room fronted on the street / canal (Herengracht - "gentleman's canal", I think), the other has a small balcony on the back. The only downside is that other rooms also front on the back - if people sit out there at 3am and chat, you will hear them. Oh, and the bathroom, while functional, is really quite small.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel on the Herengracht

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Arrived here early in the morning and as they were full the night before was not able to get in my room straight away. They were very charming took my bags and promissed that they would do there best.
reviews.title: Postcard Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I first stayed at The Ambassade in 1986 and have returned a few times over the years. The hotel is in excellent condition, spotlessly clean and decorated in a very tasteful way. They are located right on one of the prettiest canals in Amsterdam. There is plenty to do right outside your door!
reviews.title: Utterly Charming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had a room on the canal which i was worried would be noisy but I slept soundly.
reviews.title: Exceptional accommodation in the heart of Amsterdam's canal belt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: One change was that you now have to pay for your breakfast. Gone are the days of filling up on an amazing dutch feast of cheeseand meats etc. I would say that it is a bit on the expensive side but the quality is very high and the selection including hot dishes cooked to order and sparkling wine was very good!
reviews.title: Interesting, original, taste of Amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am sorry that I was only staying one night. I will be back again.
reviews.title: The View and The Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is perfectly located, on one of the central canals, within short walking distance from most points of interest in downtown Amsterdam, including the museums the palace and the rest of the canals, as well as the shopping areas. In the center of Amsterdam, having a car is in fact more of a nuisance and walking, renting a bicycle or taking the canal boats is the best way to explore the city. The bulding is an old traditional house on the canals, with a lot of charm. The house stretches between two canals. The rooms are spacious, furnished with antique charm, with tapestries and classic furniture, and with modern conveniences, spacioous bathroom with modern update. The staff very friendly and had excellent recommendations. The hotel offers breakfast, but we did not try it since we wanted to explore local bakeries and brunch places. I would stay there again and recommend it for its beauty, comfort and location.
reviews.title: Charming hotel in a traditional old dutch house by the canals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the culinary package which included all breakfasts and a dinner out at a the bluepepper restaurant. The restaurant was only so so, but the hotel itself was fabulous. Nice romantic view, beautiful room, excellent service and an amazing champagne breakfast each day.
reviews.title: 5 Star Treatment 5 Star Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is one of my best recommendations. Its cosy, friendly people, 4-5 star rooms, old fashioned but stylish and clean. Excellent breakfast served at your table with a spectacular view to the channels. This is your hotel for the romantic tour or even your busines trip:-)
reviews.title: So cosy
Nice hotel by quiet canal
reviews.text: The Ambassade is generally a nice hotel, with certain quirks that may be considered charming. Rooms are small-to-medium sized, with elements of creative floor planning. The hotel shows marks of having been expanded multiple times, with narrow, meandering corridors on slightly different levels. The stairs are extremely steep, typical for houses in the Dam. There is a single, small elevator, though.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is attentive and friendly. Rooms and en suites are nice and clean, although somewhat dated. Wifi access in the rooms is included
reviews.title: Quiet, Nice, Unique, Vintage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in room50, 1st floor, no view to speak of and quite small. there were his and hers sinks in the bathroom which was a nice touch. We used room service a couple of times, and found the service to be quick and not madly expensive. Free Internet was available (and used) downstairs in the "business centre"..there are connections in your room too. Breakfast, at 16 euros was an excellent investment. You can eat as much bread, yoghurt, fruit, cereal as you like. Egg and bacon are also available but they are delivered by the nice waiting staff. A hearty breakfast here will stave off the hunger until late afternoon! .
reviews.title: enjoyed my stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: English papers (and from usa) were available in the lobby..There is a library and a lounge area with antique pictures and a huge clock.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short- the room could have been better size-wise, but everything else was great.
reviews.title: superb experience

likes.disliked: — make sure you order breakfast ....it is huge and will set you up for the day

reviews.title: Loved the Ambassade
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights in a wonderful room w/ a balcony overlooking the canal (room 108). The room was not huge, but it was very charming. The staff was warm, friendly and efficient, the location was perfect and the bed was very comfortable. I would totally recommend the Ambassade!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Just had three days at the hotel and it was perfect. Is on a beautifal and very quiet canal, 10 mins walk from all the main areas and with terrific staff and service. Having stayed in a lot of UK hotels this year it makes such a difference when papers, internet, brollys are all available for free. Found it by accident on this site but recommend it if you want somewhere relaxed, friendly and very good value.
reviews.title: Ambassade a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: We stayed there for three days, and we had a great time. The staff were very friendly and helpful, our room was nice, and the loaction was great. The room was a little loud, but that is to be expected when you are right on the street.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Once arrived and check-in into the room we were greatly disappointed. We were given a room that was internal to the complex, with a small window facing a very small wall-enclosed dull courtyard. The room was small, too warm (no A/C), stuffy and claustrophobic. Their website does not mention these rooms, while emphasizing "canal-side house"... They charge the same price for this room as the other canal room, and this hotel is slightly more expensive relative to hotel at the same grade.
reviews.title: Great rooms IF on canal, Noisy, pricey
Terrific
reviews.text: We made sure the management understands we're not satisfied and will check-out if no solution is found. At this point, I must comment that they have responded professionally and politely (although they tried to justify the room as being very quiet per our request. But that was not the case anyway). They could Not move us on the same day as the hotel was fully booked (true), but we were given a much better room the next day.

reviews.title: fulfilled expectations
reviews.text: The new room was at floor 3 facing the beautiful canal. Indeed it has met our expectation, while matching the description in the web site. The furniture and decoration is a reminisce of 17th century Europe, while still providing all possible comforts and amenities. The bathroom looked almost new and very modern. Beds could be a bit more comfortable but still ok. The view to the canal is really nice. There is a free internet (wired) with good bandwidth. The only drawback was the noise coming from canal traffic (boats) and street (cars and pedestrians/Bikers); While not uncommon in crowded Amsterdam, We’ve slept in much quieter places in Ams, even in lower grade hotel. Double-glazed windows instead of the current simple old-looking windows would have probably help.

reviews.title: The Perfect Hotel
reviews.text: The service at the hotel is fine. Breakfast medium and less -- many near-by cafe’s to choose from with better options and less pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel through Kirker and it was everything they said it would be. It was richly furnished, centrally located, extremely comfortable and with an excellent choice of food and drink - including champagne - for breakfast. Pity it didn't serve dinner in the evening but room service was available. Concierges helpful and gave good advice on local restaurants. It is in easy reach of all the galleries and museums and we walked to them all. Access to the hotel by taxi was not too difficult and other guests did have taxis summoned. The facilities in the room did not include a minibar nor were there tea making facilities. The paintings in the corridors and dining room as well as the antiques all add to the atmosphere.
reviews.title: Luxury in the City Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I visited here in October 2012, on business, just for one night. We wanted something upmarket, but not corporate. We were very happy with the size of the room, the friendliness of the staff and the comfort of the beds. The hotel, especially the bathroom was exceptionally clean and it was a pleasure staying in a hotel that did not have a corporate, but rather a boutique type feel. The breakfast was plentiful and enjoyable and the room next to that was especially smart. The fact that we had our own entrances on the street was great. The access to the pubs and cafes close by was also what we wanted.
reviews.title: Great niche hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Ambassade is quite well located, close to sights, restaurants, shopping, etc. The staff is helpful and friendly, and speak English quite well. We enjoyed a fabulous massage at their associated Spa, as well.
reviews.title: Great location, service, hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were only in Amsterdam for a quick 24 hour layover and this hotel was exactly what we were looking for. Comfortable, cozy, and quaint! We had the attic room with a view of the canal and it was perfect. I am sure there are many other great rooms here, but I would choose the attic room again. The location is fantastic, staff is friendly and helpful, and hotel is beautiful. Wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Loved it!
In mid of city
reviews.text: Was staying for 3 nights on September, the hotel is still the same with my previous visit 25 years ago. Well maintain..good service, nice boutique hotel and great breakfast. Will get back again for my next visit...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ambassade Nov. 1-9. Our stay was a pleasant one. The room was spacious, the common areas beautiful, and the staff friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay; pleasant area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did request a room change after the first night because of noise, and the staff was most accommodating in honoring our request by moving us to room 46. Our new room was quite comfortable with a canal view. There were two easy chairs in the room that we turned around so we could see the lovely view below. The bed (king) was good and the linens nice. We had ample storage space for our 8-night stay also. The bathroom was luxurious--huge fluffy towels, marble heated flooring, a rain shower as well as a tub. The bath amenities were top notch, though if you need hair conditioner, bring some since none was provided.
reviews.title: Amsterdam 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Be sure to locate the library. It is a treasure--full of signed treasures! There are walls full of signed books by authors who have stayed at the hotel. The lounge area is also beautiful, as is the breakfast room. The hotel itself is almost a mini-art gallery with many paintings throughout. Since the hotel is actually a warren of connected canal houses, it was fun to wander around to look at the different levels (a lot of stairs!), the different hallways, the artwork.
reviews.title: Exceptional...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff, as noted above is professional and friendly. We mentioned in passing that we wanted to book a nice restaurant to celebrate my birthday our second night there. After that mention, I received many birthday wishes from everyone on the staff, and even some the next day.
reviews.title: Classy and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect--on the Herengracht in a quiet area (though that first night was noisy for some reason). Within a block or so, however, are many restaurants, the flower market, and the general bustle of the city. As we toured (mostly by walking) the city and noted where many of the major hotels are located, we were so glad we chose the Ambassade because of its calm location. And though we were not in the immediate business and tourist area, we were able to walk just about everywhere--taking the tram only twice and never felt the need for a cab.
reviews.title: Very attractive, charming hotel in excellent location.
Ambassade worth it!
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed two nights at the Ambassade in late April. This was our

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006
reviews.text: first trip to Amsterdam. The service at the Ambassade was exemplary from the
reviews.title: wonderful hotel
Ambassade On the canal
reviews.text: moment our cab arrived (actually- from the time I emailed them regarding making

reviews.title: Will stay here again!
reviews.text: reservations on the busiest day of the year- Queen's Day) until we left two

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: mornings later. Our room and amenities were fabulous (admittedly, the building

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed at the Ambassade for 5 days. We had a lovely, spacious canal-view room (requested when we reserved). I was amazed by how quiet the room was, despite being on street level. All staff were extremely polite and friendly. Public areas of the hotel are charming, with original prints and paintings by Dutch artists on the walls, antique furniture and decorative objects, and a cozy library lined with books written by authors who have stayed at the hotel. This is not a hotel for anyone with mobility problems; because it is made up of many old townhouses that have been connected, there are narrow, winding stairs between floors, and many rooms are quite distant from the front desk. If that is not a problem for you, this is a wonderful hotel, located in a charming and convenient part of Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent and helpful staff, beautiful room. I really enjoyed the traditional canal house atmosphere. Great breakfast. All the amenities you'd want. Luxurious.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — Beautiful location on the canal, excellent staff, gorgeous room, traditional canal house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: We picked this hotel based on comments here and its location. I think we fared quite well!
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived early on a Wednesday morning weary and tired from an all night plane ride! Lo and behold they had our rooms ready!!
reviews.title: We loved staying at the Ambassade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are decorated in antiques and great beds. We stayed in suites 46 and 47. The bathrooms are a bit small but well appointed. My only advice on the bathroom is to make sure you put a towel on the floor. There are no shower curtains!
reviews.title: We were lucky

likes.liked: — view of the canal, nice service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: This hotel can be pleasant, but only if you get one of the good rooms. We did not. Although we had reserved several months in advance, when we arrived we were shown into a basement room - the only window was facing the stairwell leading down from the street. There was therefore neither light nor privacy. The fittings and furniture were of poor quality. The staff member who showed us to the room clearly knew it was a disgrace and ran away as fast as he could.
reviews.title: Beware!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At a quarter of the price, the room might have been acceptable. But for a hotel that boasts of its elegance and amenities, it was shamfeul. We complained, and 24 hours later were moved to a superior room - but without an apology for having stuck us in a basement for a day.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

likes.liked: — Room (only those with cana view) and Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing on the hotel's website gives an inkling that one could end up shunted into such inferior and unpleasant accomodation.
reviews.title: Why go to Venice when you have Amsterdam

likes.liked: — our room faced the canal - how much nicer can it get?
